intro: Myanthus cernuus, commonly known as the nodding myanthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine pubescence. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
